required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BOO and DU and Their Clinical and Urodynamic Findings in Women With ≥Stage II Cystocele
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence Rates of Bladder Outlet Obstruction and Detrusor Underactivity and Their Clinical and Urodynamic Findings in Women With ≥Stage II Cystocele

brief_summary.textblock: Prevalence rates of bladder outlet obstruction (BOO) and detrusor underactivity (DU) and their related clinical and urodynamic findings in women with ≥ pelvic organ prolapse quantification stage II cystocele are important for clinical consultation. Thus, the aim of this study was to elucidate the above findings and between-group associations.

detailed_description.textblock: Between November 2011 and January 2017, medical records of all women with ≥stage II cystocele who underwent 20 min pad testing and urodynamic studies in a medical center were reviewed. Only those with complete data of maximum flow rate (Qmax) and detrusor pressure at maximum flow rate (PdetQmax) were enrolled. ANOVA test and post-hoc testing with bonferroni's correction were used for statistical analysis. Woman were defined as having DU when Qmax was <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was <10 cmH2O, and were defined as having BOO when Qmax was <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was ≥25 cmH2O with sustained detrusor contraction during voiding cystometry.

primary_outcome.description: Bladder outlet obstruction: Qmax was <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was ≥25 cmH2O with sustained detrusor contraction during voiding cystometry.
Detrusor underactivity: <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was <10 cmH2O

clinical_study.condition: Bladder Outlet Obstruction and Detrusor Underactivity in Women With Severe Cystocele

arm_group.description: Between November 2011 and January 2017, medical records of all women with ≥stage II cystocele who underwent 20 min pad testing and urodynamic studies in a medical center were reviewed. Woman were defined as having BOO when Qmax was <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was ≥25 cmH2O with sustained detrusor contraction during voiding cystometry.

Between November 2011 and January 2017, medical records of all women with ≥stage II cystocele who underwent 20 min pad testing and urodynamic studies in a medical center were reviewed. Woman were defined as having DU when Qmax was <12 mL/s and PdetQmax was <10 cmH2O during voiding cystometry.

Between November 2011 and January 2017, medical records of all women with ≥stage II cystocele who underwent 20 min pad testing and urodynamic studies in a medical center were reviewed. This group revealed no demonstrated bladder outlet obstruction nor detrusor underactivity.

intervention.description: 20-minutes pad test and urodynamic study including uroflowmetry, filling cystometry and voiding cystometry.

study_pop.textblock: Women with more than stage II cystocele

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age > 20y/o
2. Cystocele > stage II
3. Complete pad test and urodynamic study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy
2. Urinary tract infection
3. Had received pelvic reconstruction surgery
